steps: Log in or create a new account

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Creates a new token

args.name: clientId
args.info: The client id obtained from StackOverflow.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: The client secret obtained from StackOverflow.

blocks.name: invalidateAccessToken
blocks.description: Immediately expires the access token passed. This method is meant to allow an application to discard any active access tokens it no longer needs.

blocks.name: deAuthenticateApplication
blocks.description: This method is meant for uninstalling applications, recovering from access_token leaks

blocks.name: getMe
blocks.description: Returns the user associated with the passed accessToken

args.name: sortingOrder
args.info: Ascending or descending sorting order. Possible values: asc and desc(default).

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Parameter to sort by. Possible values: reputation(default), creation, name, modified.

args.name: min
args.info: Specify the range of a field must fall in (that field being specified by sortBy)

args.name: max
args.info: Specify the range of a field must fall in (that field being specified by sortBy)

blocks.name: getUsersByIds
blocks.description: Returns information about the user with provided Ids

args.name: sortingOrder
args.info: Ascending or descending sorting order. Possible values: asc and desc(default).

args.info: Parameter to sort by. Possible values: reputation(default), creation, name, modified.

args.name: min
args.info: Specify the range of a field must fall in (that field being specified by sortBy)

args.name: max
args.info: Specify the range of a field must fall in (that field being specified by sortBy)

blocks.name: getUsers
blocks.description: Returns all users on a site.

args.name: inName
args.info: The inName parameter lets consumers filter the results down to just those users with a certain substring in their display name.

args.name: sortingOrder
args.info: Ascending or descending sorting order. Possible values: asc and desc(default).

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Parameter to sort by. Possible values: reputation(default), creation, name, modified.

args.name: max
args.info: Specify the range of a field must fall in (that field being specified by sortBy)

blocks.name: getModerators
blocks.description: Gets those users on a site who can exercise moderation powers. Note, employees of Stack Exchange Inc. will be returned if they have been granted moderation powers on a site even if they have never been appointed or elected explicitly. This method checks abilities, not the manner in which they were obtained.

args.name: sortingOrder
args.info: Ascending or descending sorting order. Possible values: asc and desc(default).

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Parameter to sort by. Possible values: reputation(default), creation, name, modified.

args.name: min
args.info: Specify the range of a field must fall in (that field being specified by sortBy)

args.name: max
args.info: Specify the range of a field must fall in (that field being specified by sortBy)

blocks.name: getElectedModerators
blocks.description: Returns those users on a site who both have moderator powers, and were actually elected. This method excludes Stack Exchange Inc. employees, unless they were actually elected moderators on a site (which can only have happened prior to their employment).

args.name: sortingOrder
args.info: Ascending or descending sorting order. Possible values: asc and desc(default).

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Parameter to sort by. Possible values: reputation(default), creation, name, modified.

args.name: min
args.info: Specify the range of a field must fall in (that field being specified by sortBy)

args.name: max
args.info: Specify the range of a field must fall in (that field being specified by sortBy)

blocks.name: getMyTimeline
blocks.description: Get a subset of the actions of that have been taken by the users identified by accessToken.

blocks.name: getUserTimeline
blocks.description: Get a subset of the actions of that have been taken by the users identified by id.

blocks.description: Returns all the undeleted answers in the system.

blocks.description: Returns a user's inbox associated with accessToken

blocks.name: getMyAssociatedAccounts
blocks.description: Returns all of a user's associated accounts, given an acccessToken for them.

args.name: accountTypes
args.info: You can filter the accountTypes returned by this method with the types parameter. Specify, semicolon delimited, main_site or meta_site to filter by site.

args.name: accountTypes
args.info: You can filter the accountTypes returned by this method with the types parameter. Specify, semicolon delimited, main_site or meta_site to filter by site.

blocks.name: getUserActivity
blocks.description: Returns a summary of a user's activity across the Stack Exchange network, given their userId.

blocks.name: getMyUnreadNotifications
blocks.description: Returns a user's unread notifications, given an accessToken.

blocks.name: getUserUnreadNotifications
blocks.description: Returns a user's unread notifications with provided userId.

blocks.name: search
blocks.description: Returns the user identified by userId top 30 tags by combined question and answer score.

args.name: searchString
args.info: A free form text parameter, will match all question properties based on an undocumented algorithm.

args.name: sortingOrder
args.info: Ascending or descending sorting order. Possible values: asc and desc(default).

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Parameter to sort by. Possible values: activity(default), creation, votes, relevance.

args.name: min
args.info: Specify the range of a field must fall in (that field being specified by sortBy)

args.name: max
args.info: Specify the range of a field must fall in (that field being specified by sortBy)

args.name: accepted
args.info: true to return only questions with accepted answers, false to return only those without.

args.name: minAnswers
args.info: The minimum number of answers returned questions must have

args.name: questionBody
args.info: Text which must appear in returned questions' bodies.

args.name: closed
args.info: true to return only closed questions, false to return only open ones

args.name: migrated
args.info: true to return only questions migrated away from a site, false to return only those not.

args.name: notice
args.info: true to return only questions with post notices, false to return only those without.

args.name: exceptTags
args.info: A semicolon delimited list of tags, none of which will be present on returned questions. At least one additional parameter must be set if exceptTags is set, for performance reasons.

args.name: withTags
args.info: A semicolon delimited list of tags, of which at least one will be present on all returned questions.

args.name: questionTitle
args.info: Text which must appear in returned questions' titles.

args.name: questionerId
args.info: The id of the user who must own the questions returned.

args.name: withUrl
args.info: A url which must be contained in a post, may include a wildcard.

args.name: minViews
args.info: The minimum number of views returned questions must have.

args.name: wiki
args.info: True to return only community wiki questions, false to return only non-community wiki ones.
